article.title: Library Systems Analysis Guidelines
article.author: Chapman, E.a.
article.text: This book aims primarily to provide guidelines for library administrators and library systems analysts in analyzing and evaluating existing operating systems and in designing new or improved ones. In addition, we have found the material to be very useful in staff training programs conducted to ensure knowledgeable staff participation and cooperation in a systems study. This guide is also adaptable for introducing library school students to the concepts of systems study in the library.
